glsa.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Several remotely exploitable bugs have been found in CUPS, which allow remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: CUPS is the Common Unix Printing System.

description.p: Several buffer overflows were found in:

ul.li: The read_rle16 function in imagetops (CVE-2008-3639, found by regenrecht, reported via ZDI)
The WriteProlog function in texttops (CVE-2008-3640, found by regenrecht, reported via ZDI)
The Hewlett-Packard Graphics Language (HPGL) filter (CVE-2008-3641, found by regenrecht, reported via iDefense)

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted input to a vulnerable server, resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the server.

resolution.p: All CUPS users should upgrade to the latest version.
